Name: Cvitanovich
Title: Great site to visit if your in the area visiting Charminar
Review: There is great history with Mecca Masjid and be sure to read up on it or pull out Wikipedia while you are there.  It is used for prayer so, be sure to be prepared to take off your shoes when visiting. PLEASE be aware, you will be approached if you do not look Indian by "guides" that will tell you the history which you can get from Wikipedia. They will tour you around the place and then ask for a donation.  The same can be said for the man at watching over your shoes.  He wanted money so I gave him American Dollars since I did not have rupees but wanted $5 to get my shoes back.  Oh, be aware even though you have to take your shoes off, the floors are dirty in some areas covered in pigeon poop.

Name: Jo-Ann
Title: Uniquely old
Review: Great architecture. Foreign visitors are welcome to visit the inside of the mosque. There is a lady outside who would make sure ladies have scarves around their necks before entering the mosque.

Name: kcdebnath
Title: Mecca Masjid in Hyderabad
Review: It was 15th August, 19. We reached Hyderabad late from Vellore by Sabari Express. After checked in our hotel at Abids we decided to visit Charminar in the afternoon. Every body knows that Charminar is the iconic of Hyderabad City, the most beautiful monument in the heart of Hyderabad.  We reached in the evening. The place is very crowded as it was Independence Day. We spent some time there. Then we visited Mecca Masjid, one of the largest in the world, situated on the south west of Charminar. Here also we a lot of visitors assembled. All are in festive mood. we were interested to pay a visit there. First we faced a tight security. However we entered the masjid area. Why Mecca Masjid, the name given? Some say the founder, Mohammad Quli Qutub Shah commissioned the construction who asked for soil to be brought in from the holy Islamic site of Mecca. He laid the foundation stone of this mosque in 1641. Some say that a few bricks from holy shrine from Mecca were embedded in it .Another view that only one brick was brought from Mecca. However, the mosque was completed by Aurangzeb,in 1694,  the Mughal Emperor, after conquering Golkunda in 1687. It is so big that it can accommodate 10,000 worshippers in its prayer hall. The architecture is beautiful, one of a Heritage Building in Hyderabad. It is worth visiting along with the Charminar.

Name: Wilayat
Title: Prayers
Review: The entrance to the courtyard is one of the mosque's most striking features with a rectangular, arched, and canopied building that houses the marble graves of the Asaf jahi  rulers.

Name: Sounak Poddar
Title: Heritage Building
Review: Just next to Charminar, a heritage building in the town. Still Standing strong and a beautiful structure. Could have been maintained a bit more, but overall nice place to visit during Ramzan, then one will get the taste of the market in front of that area as well but make sure you don't have a vehicle with yourself because during that period all the roads are blocked.

Name: Arun Karthik
Title: Heritage Place
Review: The aura and sanctity that one gets to feel near Mecca Masjid Hyderabad is simply incomparable. Founded by Muhammad Quli Qutub Shah, the fifth ruler of Qutub Shahi dynasty, it is one of the biggest and the oldest mosques in South India. It is said that he himself laid the foundation stone and the bricks used to construct the central arch of the mosque have been made from soil sourced from Mecca. This is the reason behind the mosque getting its name as Mecca Masjid.It has the capacity to accommodate 10,000 worshippers to offer prayers at a time. About 8000 workers were involved in the construction of this mosque that draws hundreds of tourists from all across the globe, not just for its historical or religious importance but also for its spectacular beauty.A few common sights at this sacred place include feeding of pigeons considered to be a virtue in the Muslim community and devotees sitting by the side of an artificial pond installed in the mosque. As per a legend, whoever sits on the two stones and slab benches beside the pond always comes back to sit on them again

Review: Great mosque. Love the Hauz, pretty rare to find these days. At the time, construction is still going on, so probably would like to visit once its complete.

Name: FaisalNM
Title: Worth visiting
Review: The Masjid lies in the very crowded Charminar area. Most area around the masjid was kept free from Hawkers during the Friday prayer time, which is great.Shoe keeping is done by local people at various places, they keep your shoes and give you a handmade token.The pond for ablution was disappointing. Full of bird feathers and dried leaves and dust floating on it, however, there is a separate place with taps for ablution too but not clearly visible, we had to ask if there was one.The prayer sermon or khudba was in Arabic instead of the widely spoken and understood Urdu which was surprising.The interior of the masjid is spellbinding, mainly because it's very high. Almost four to five storeys high ceiling.Chandelier were covered in cloth thought and fans kept things cool.Albeit run down and under maintenance, it still gave the old time flavour and one could feel they are back in time by say 40-50 years.Worth visiting and experiencing if in Hyderabad.

Name: ShvRm_Traveller

The mosque is in use and has a religious significance as well as the archaeological important. Women have to cover their head to enter the mosque. Overall, it is a decent structure but for a casual visitor, it may not appear, very different from the other similar structures of its time.

Title: Close to Char Minar

Name: SandeepSaxena-IIP
Title: Mecca Masjid- oldest mosques in Hyderabad
Review: Mecca Masjid, is one of the oldest mosques in Hyderabad, Telangana in India, and it is one of the largest masjids in India. Makkah Masjid is a listed heritage building in the old city of Hyderabad, close to the historic landmarks of Chowmahalla Palace, Laad Bazaar, and Charminar.The main feature of Mecca Masjid is its hall which is about 23 meters high, 67 meters wide and 55 meters long. The three walls of this huge hall are supported by fifteen arches, five arches each. Each of the fifteen arches is portrayed with sermons from the Holy Book of Quran. It is said that the hall of Mecca Masjid can accommodate about 10,000 people at a time during worship.There is a pond within the complex with seating arrangements at the edges. There is also a room in the courtyard that stores holy relics, among which the most important is the hair of Prophet Mohammed.

Name: RainedOnInRedmond
Title: Be on guard here - tourist trap
Review: Have visited many mosques and other religious monuments in many countries.  Not the best experience here.  I am white so I stand out as a tourist.  Came around lunchtime.  I came into the courtyard and you have to take off your shoes and socks and when you come back they will expect you to pay for their watching your shoes.  I came in and an old guy offered to show me something interesting (which should have been a red flag, my error) and he took me around the corner to show me some graves of the local rules.  Then him and another old Muslim guy started pressuring me to deposit some money on this grave and say a prayer, and I realized that I was now out of view of the crowd and alone with these two guys who are trying to extract money.  I politely walked away, back to where the shoes are.  By this time my feet have ample dirt on them.  I walked around in the courtyard toward the main mosque and it's impressive enough.  However the cobblestones were filthy on my bare feet and I decided to go look around other things in the Charminar area instead.It would probably be a better experience with a guide or local friend.

A lofty wall covers the west of the Mecca Masjid. It has been named after the Grand Mosque that is situated at Mecca. Review: A nice place to visit in Hyderabad. Located adjacent to Charminar. This is one of the largest mosques in India with 10,000 capacity. The tombs of the first six Nizams are located in main courtyard.

Name: Adnan_Chowdhury67
Title: Juma prayers at the iconic mosque
Review: Visiting from Bangladesh, I had the wonderful opportunity to visit and pray at this iconic Mosque that is one of the oldest mosques in Hyderabad, India and it is one of the largest in India. Makkah Masjid is a listed as a  heritage building in India.The mosque was completed in 1694 and can accommodate 20,000 faithful. Though I am pretty I didn't see 20,000 it was full a huge gathering this juma.The mosque has a water reservoir where the water is bright sky blue. It's an amazing  scene.After prayers I stopped at one of the fruit juices shops and had the best orange jiuce for around a dollar ! It was chilled and really the spot after a  long day.Make sure you visit this place. Is steps away from Charminar. Non muslims are welcome after prayer time.

Name: Noor Ali Abbas
Title: Amazing Architecture
Review: Makkah Masjid is an amazing architectural monument. It is the oldest and the largest mosque of Hyderabad city. As the name indicates, it was build with stones from Makkah, Saudi Arabia.The mosque is very clean and looks very beautiful. It has a large prayer hall with attractive lights. Separate prayer hall for ladies is also available.The area around the mosque is very crowded and it attracts tourists since it is located near Charminar. However there were two things that really bothered me. 1st, lack of regular cleaning and maintenance. There were pigeon poop everywhere. Secondly, there should be better security! I mean, the main entrance had all kinds of checking and frisking. But if you happen to come by the back door, you can just enter without any Security Check! Name: JaganRampal

Name: Anamika K

Review: It's beautiful Masjid one can enjoy it's views from Charminar view points,famous in hyderabad.It has beautiful pond too

The place has a very big central halls, several pillars and minarets.  The town of Nizams is housed here.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: peaceful place
Review: You will feel peaceful once you go to this place though there is a buzz of the crowd.there is a place to keep the bags and can be collected.you can see a lot of pigeons here.Since its a spiritual place guys cant wear shorts and women should wear appropriately

Name: Shailendra
Title: Historic mosque
Review: Located next to Charminar, Mecca mosque is one the prominent historical monument in Hyderabad. Architecture is simple and stable.Worth a visit if you are visiting Charminar.

Name: Bhavik Mody
Title: Grand Icon of Religion
Review: Mecca Masjid is situated besides the Charminar and is considered to be one of the biggest masjids of India. It is grand and huge. Made up of black stone it has its own way of impressing piousness on each one who enters the premises. If you are going to Charminar do visit this place. Won't take much time and will be an experience of its own

Name: Farjad A
Title: Wonderfully historic
Review: Very evocative mosque, full of elegance and history. The resting place of some former Nizam's. Really encapsulates Hyderabad.

Name: shekhehshan
Title: feeling like mecca
Review: very peaceful and historical place to visit. i was here during maghrib time to offer prayer.what a relief i got after nama that i cant explain in words.also a great place for leisure time.we can also see charminar from the mosque campus.

Name: Prasobh K
Title: Holy place - please do visit
Review: Mecca Masjid in the Charminar area is a great holy place to visit and offer prayers. Please do visit irrespective of your faith for a peaceful prayer !!

Name: trolleybag786
Title: Mecca Masjid
Review: A beautiful piece of architecture just a few meters away from the Charminar. Quiet and peaceful. Entry inside the mosque is restricted to followers of the religion.

Name: Krishna Sandeep Siram
Title: Must place to visit
Review: This place is peaceful and we can get mind relaxation playing with the pigeons and it is must when we visit charminar.!!

Name: Sree p
Title: Worth a visit
Review: This masjid is very next to the Charminar..... This provides an opportunity to anyone who has ever visited a masjid before...
